thread.title: Pipeline protesters hang banner inside U.S. Bank Stadium during game
thread.title_full: Pipeline protesters hang banner inside U.S. Bank Stadium during game

title: Pipeline protesters hang banner inside U.S. Bank Stadium during game
text: Two protestors managed to drop a banner and rappel from the rafters of U.S. Bank Stadium during the second quarter of Sunday’s Vikings game. Play was not interrupted as the two men, one wearing a No. 4 Brett Favre Vikings jersey, were suspended in air above section 120. Six rows of fans were cleared below the protestors. The activists dropped a banner that read “Divest #NoDAPL” with the U.S. Bank logo above, furthering activism against the Dakota Access Pipeline and its investors. Last month, protestors in Minneapolis entered Wells Fargo’s offices and began blocking employees on their way to work.
